alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 4:47AM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, light snow is ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Byers, Limon, and Akron. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org
